com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveLibraryChildIf

All Superinterfaces:
Node, XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNodeIf
All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveBlobNodeIf, XhiveDocumentIf, XhiveLibraryIf, XhiveLinkBaseIf
public interface XhiveLibraryChildIf
extends XhiveNodeIf, XhiveLockingContextIf

Shared interface for documents, libraries and blobs. All of these objects can be a child of a library, hence the name.

Documents and libraries can have indexes. These indexes are stored in the indexlist. The owner document or library of the indexlist serves as the context of the index, which means that the indexes apply to all nodes descending the library child. Create indexes by using the factory methods on XhiveIndexListIf.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

Method Detail

executeFullPathXPointerQuery

java.util.Iterator executeFullPathXPointerQuery(java.lang.String query)

Executes a full path XPointer query on this library child. A full path query allows you to specify the full path to the document(s) on which the query is performed, including the library steps (which is not possible using executeXPathQuery).

The queryExpression should have the following syntax: [libraryChild path]#[XPointer query] In which both the libraryChild path and the XPointer part are optional.

You can also specify an version-id of get a specific version of the document that is the result of the libraryChild path, then the syntax is: [libraryChild path]##version-id#[XPointer query]

The libraryChild path can be either relative to this library child or absolute (starting from the root library). The path can contain either libraryChild names or libraryChild ids, the latter should be prefixed by "id:".

Example queries:

  • /Plays/JCaesar#xpointer(/descendent:SPEECH) - absolute path to the JCaesar document, return all SPEECH elements
  • ../JCaesar - relative path to the JCaesar document, returns the document
  • /id:0 - absolute path to the library with id 0, returns the library
  • /Plays/JCaesar##label1#xpointer(/descendent:SPEECH) - absolute path to the version labeled label1 of the JCaesar document, return all SPEECH elements

Returns:
An iterator that offers access to all nodes that are a result of evaluation of the query expression.
Throws:
XhiveException - If no query-results are found (it is an error in XPointer to have a query not return results).
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

getByPath

XhiveLibraryChildIf getByPath(java.lang.String path)

Shortcut for executeFullPathXPointerQuery, which can be used to get a document or library from anywhere in the database. Use this method instead of executeFullPathXPointerQuery when you are only looking for one specific document or library.

The libraryChild path can be either relative to this library child or absolute (starting from the root library). The path can contain either libraryChild names or libraryChild ids, the latter should be prefixed by "id:".

Example queries:

  • /Plays/JCaesar - absolute path to the JCaesar document
  • ../JCaesar - relative path to the JCaesar document, returns the document
  • /id:0 - absolute path to the library (or document) with id 0
  • /Plays/JCaesar##1.3 - absolute path to version 1.3 of the JCaesar document

Returns:
The library or document indicated by the path, or null if no match could be found.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

X-Hive/DB 1.1

setName

void setName(java.lang.String newName)
Change the name of the library child. The new name must be unique in its locking context. Any existing name for this library child is overwritten.

WARNING: Libraries containing a large number of named child nodes should have a library name index to maintain the performance of functions setName(), XhiveLibraryIf.get(String name) and full path XPointer queries.

Parameters:
newName - the new name of the library child.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
for more information about adding library name indexes.

getFullPath

java.lang.String getFullPath()
Get the full path, which you can use to access the library child with executeFullPathXPointerQuery.

Returns:
A string that uniquely identifies the library child in the database. Although you can retrieve this library child with executeFullPathXPointerQuery, this string is not a valid XPointer expression.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
executeFullPathXPointerQuery(java.lang.String)

getIndexList

XhiveIndexListIf getIndexList()
Get the indexlist. The indexlist creates and stores new indexes. Only documents and libraries can have an index. Other objects of type LibraryChildIf throw an exception when calling this function.

Returns:
the indexlist
Throws:
INDEX_LIST_NOT_SUPPORTED - when objects other than documents and libraries call this function.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

getOptions

int getOptions()
Get the combination of options that were set for the library child upon creation.

Returns:
the combination of options for the library child.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0

serialize

void serialize(java.io.OutputStream out)
               throws java.io.IOException
Serialize this library child to the given output stream. The library child is written in an internal binary format suitable for loading with XhiveLibraryIf.deserialize(java.io.InputStream). If this is a library, all children of the library will be serialized as well (recursively).

Any versioned documents are written with their complete version history of all branches.

Index definitions of this library child and any descendants are stored with the data. On restoration, the contents of any live indexes are restored from the data. Content conditioned indexes will be empty.

Parameters:
out - The output stream to write to. No buffering is done internally, so be sure to use a java.io.BufferedOutputStream where it matters. The stream is flushed, but not closed, by this method.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Only if the output stream passed throws a java.io.IOException.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.1

getMetadata

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadata()
This is a shortcut for getMetadata(true).

Returns:
The metadata of this library child.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.1
See Also:
getMetadata(boolean)

getMetadata

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getMetadata(boolean versionable)
Retrieves the metadata of this library child. The map returned can contain only strings as keys and values. Keys cannot be null, values can be null. Modifying this map directly modifies the metadata in the database. Such modification is not allowed if this library child is a versioned document or blob and the metadata is versionable.

Parameters:
versionable - Whether any newly added or modified metadata fields are versionable. This has no effect on what fields can be retrieved or deleted.
Returns:
The metadata of this library child.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getXhiveVersion

XhiveVersionIf getXhiveVersion()
Get the current version object for this library child.

Returns:
The version of this library child if it's versioned otherwise null.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

makeVersionable

XhiveVersionIf makeVersionable()
Make this library child versionable by creating a versionspace for it and storing this library child as the first version.

Returns:
The first version in the new versionspace (1.1) that is associated with this library child.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0
